Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yewah... if you use config.ini it will import that private key to each chain

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Ahh right, yep I set that up now

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That way, if anything goes wrong you can clear the chain data, even wallet... and everything is safe...

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Currently in `/staked/` it still says `btcpubkey:`, should be `kmdpubkey:` I'm guessing

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Probably not high on the priority list

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not its btc pubkey üòâ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: thats its actual name... the pubkey will work on any BTC fork

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and generate a diffrent address

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: oh wow, didn't know that. In the config.ini is there a way to input multiple addresses in there?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: as in, an `[ADDRESS2]` or some similar option?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
no curentl;y not...  the proiblem is that CC contracts all use -pubkey to determine your working address
So I made config.ini so that the daemons all load up with it already set, and address imported.... It stops a large amount of OP error and needless questions needing to be asked by people.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I made an RPC to set the -pubkey in runtime, but it only works to set it once, you cant change it...

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Ah right, so you'd just have to manually import other addresses if you wanted to

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also a fix was pushed to staked ropo recently that fixes the private key import it was broken on old release for some time.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes, but its not really recomended to do so if dealing with CC's just use the one address.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: maybe you could have multiple config.inis and restart if diffrent address's were needed?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: So the idea will to be only ever have 1 usable address?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think that would work... your balance would show incoprrectly, because of other address's but it should still work.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: for CC's yes pretty much.... I dont see an easy way of fixing that its a pretty low level thing for CCs that it uses -pubkey

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Maybe my RPC can be unlocked to allow changing -pubkey in runtime... but I really dont think it will be safe... once it has been set lots of things assume it to never changes.
